title: Jurgen Klopp fires big warning to struggling Liverpool stars: "We are all playing for our future here"
text:
Thank you for subscribing!   
Jurgen Klopp has warned his struggling Liverpool stars that they are playing for futures at the club. 
Liverpool slumped to a 3-1 defeat at relegation-threatened Leicester on Monday night, throwing the Reds' top four aspirations into dissaray. 
Furious Klopp says that the reaction from Leicester following the departure of Claudio Ranieri was expected, but his players should have been up for the fight. 
And now the German insists that he will not be afraid to axe his flopping stars. 
"I'm not worried," Klopp said. "I probably should be but we have a week to prepare for next game. Liverpool players look dejected after going 3-0 down (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Klopp was left raging at his side's poor showing (Photo: Andrew Powell) Read More Jamie Carragher: "Both teams should hang their heads in shame" 
"We are all playing for our future here. 
"I don't want to be too serious but that's how it is. We can be better and not doing it feels really disappointing. 
"Thank God we don't have to play again tomorrow. Now we have to react again." 
Leicester found themselves three goals up on the hour mark after a Jamie Vardy double and a Danny Drinkwater volley. 
Philippe Coutinho's strike only proved to be a consolation. Jamie Vardy got on the scoresheet with two strikes (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Coutinho's late goal was nothing more than a consolation (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More #KloppOUT! Liverpool fans go into meltdown after defeat to Leicester 
"A bad start, bad in the middle and bad at the end," Klopp reflected. 
"We had a few better than average moments but most of the game was not even average. It was clear what would happen tonight, it was an emotional night but we have to show what we are fighting for. 
"We knew how Leicester would play, go back to their roots. We could have done much better. We let them be Leicester of last year - that's our fault. 
"We should get criticised. This inconsistency makes absolutely no sense. Liverpool appeared to be beaten to every ball (Photo: PA) Leicester continually looked to get away from Liverpool (Photo: AFP) Big changes could be required at Liverpool (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More Craig Shakespeare knew Leicester would win during the WARM UP 
"I have already spoken in the dressing room to the players, that performance was not enough for sure. We have to try with everything we have to do better. 
"If you are not good enough you lose football games. I have no reason for this at the moment. You can always find excuses but I'm not ready to look for one. 
"We had opportunities to do more throughout the game - we changed system at half-time but the crosses into the box were not good enough. We could have scored a second goal and that may have changed the game." poll loading Should Liverpool sack Jurgen Klopp? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
